title: Pakistan women’s team camp for Bangladesh tour kicks off October 13
text:
National team’s camp for Bangladesh tour will take place from October 13 to 23 at the Lahore Country Club, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) announced on Friday.

As many as 16 players including Aliya Riaz, Anam Amin, Ayesha Zafar, Bismah Maroof, Diana Baig, Fareeha Mahmood, Iram Javed, Javeria Khan, Kainat Imtiaz, Nahida Khan, Omaima Sohail, Saba Nazir, Sadia Iqbal, Sana Mir, Sidra Amin and Sidra Nawaz will take part in a 10-day training camp.

Bangladesh to tour Lahore to play three T20I matches and two ODIs against the home side from October 26. This will be Pakistan’s first series after the departure of Mark Coles, who resigned earlier this month citing family problems.

A three-member selection committee of the women’s team selected the players for the camp. According to the chief selector, Urooj Mumtaz, they have given a chance to some emerging cricketers.

“We have identified some exciting talent during the camp and the tournament. In the Bangladesh series, we would like to give an opportunity to some emerging players who have showcased their talent and skill and possess the exuberance of youth,” she said in a statement released by the PCB.
